eecs.jago
Interface Realism

All Known Implementing Classes:
ElementManager, RobotGuiBase, RobotTracks, SimBox, SimEngine, StandardRobot, StandardSensor
public interface Realism

This interface is implemented by any object that has functionality that matches a physical device.

Field Summary
static int FIXED_REALISTIC
          Indicates that all elements should operate in a realistic manner, but should not be random each time.
static int IDEALISTIC
          Indicates that any element should react idealistically (does not adhere to the expectations of the real object)
static int REALISTIC
          Indicates that all elements should attempt to act realistically (as close to the modeled object as possible).
 
Method Summary
 int getRealismLevel()
          Gets the realism setting (as a constant)
 void setRealismLevel(int level)
          Sets the realism level.
 

Field Detail

FIXED_REALISTIC

public static final int FIXED_REALISTIC
Indicates that all elements should operate in a realistic manner, but should not be random each time. This allows testing of a system with components acting realistically, but predictably. As an example, if a robot is created in this mode, it will be created with drag on each motor, but it will always have the same drag (REALISTIC mode generates a new random drag each time a robot is created).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

IDEALISTIC

public static final int IDEALISTIC
Indicates that any element should react idealistically (does not adhere to the expectations of the real object)

See Also:
Constant Field Values

REALISTIC

public static final int REALISTIC
Indicates that all elements should attempt to act realistically (as close to the modeled object as possible).

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

setRealismLevel

public void setRealismLevel(int level)
Sets the realism level.

Parameters:
level - A constant from Realism

getRealismLevel

public int getRealismLevel()
Gets the realism setting (as a constant)

Returns:
Returns one of the Realism constants, currently IDEALISTIC, REALISTIC, or FIXED_REALISTIC
